title: Business Live: Euro falls after ECB cut - BBC News
summary: euro falls after ecb says it will cut back on bond-buying from january .
bt 's landline only customers to see bills fall .
300,000 people a year leave their jobs over mental health problems .
barclays shares fall by 4.5 % following results .
debenhams lose ground after profits fall .

text: that 's all from the business live page for today .
see you bright and early tomorrow for a 6:00am kick off .

documents.title: march of the robots reaches supermarket shelves
text: us supermarket giant wal-mart , which owns asda , is planning to introduce shelf-scanning robots in 40 stores to save time on re-stocking products .

wal-mart 's chief technology officer , jeremy king , tells reuters : `` if you are running up and down the aisle , and you want to decide if we are out of cheerios or not , a human does n't do that job very well and they do n't like it . ''
the robots are two feet high , with towers on their backs fitted with cameras .
mr king says that the bots are 50 % more productive , can scan shelves three times faster than their human counterparts and are significantly more accurate .

documents.title: catalan leader says not enough guarantees from madrid to call election
text: the catalan leader , carles puigdemont , has said he 's not prepared to call snap elections in the absence of guarantees from madrid .
in a much-delayed speech , he said he would n't do so while the spanish government was threatening to take away catalonia 's autonomy .
the spanish senate is due to approve the government 's intervention proposals on friday .
mr puigdemont said he would leave it to the catalan parliament to debate the crisis , but correspondents say he appears to be waiting for the spanish government to make the next move .
separatists outside the catalan government building are demanding a unilateral declaration of independence .

documents.title: ftse 100 holds up as barclays dives after results
text: the ftse 100 has closed higher but barclays shares tumbled after missing estimates for third quarter profit .

`` the main thing ( with barclays ) is there 's been a big drop in the income from the investment bank , which is more of a market-wide issue and probably a bit of sideways movement in the rest of the business , '' said laith khalaf , senior analyst at hargreaves lansdown .
`` it 's a bit of a damp squib of a set of results . ''
the share index closed 0.53 % higher at 7,486.95 points .

documents.title: twitter results go down well
text: twitter shares have jumped more than 14 % following its results .
the company said it might finally make a profit in the last quarter of the year .
quarterly revenue was $ 590m , 4 % down on a year ago .
losses were $ 21m , well down on last year 's $ 103m .
twitter also owned up to a blunder - it had been inaccurately measuring its user base since 2014 and has had to dial that down - only by 1 % though .
the company reported 330 million monthly active users in the third quarter .

documents.title: barclays shares languish
text: barclays shares have dropped to a low for the day of 181p , after a very sharp drop for a 100 stock of 7.6 % .
the fall follows results that fell well short of investor expectations .

documents.title: las vegas sands to build london-themed resort in china
text: not quite on the same scale as the saudi city plan , but still
us gaming giant las vegas sands has unveiled plans for a london-themed resort in macau .
the resort is part of plans to spend $ 1.1bn ( £ 830m ) on renovating the firm 's five properties in china 's gambling enclave .
sands said that the revamped resort would feature some `` recognisable landmarks '' .
read more here .

documents.title: branson joins saudi mega city
text: virgin group 's richard branson is getting involved with the mega city that saudi arabia is planning .
he says : `` i will invest .
i 've been asked to be on the board of one or two of your city projects - your red sea project - and am delighted to accept , '' he told an investment conference in riyadh .
on tuesday saudi arabia announced a $ 500bn cross-border city development project on the red sea .

documents.title: dunkin ' donuts down
text: dunkin ' brands group , which owns the dunkin ' donuts chain , announces a surprise fall in sales at its baskin-robbins restaurants .
dunkin ' brands said sales were down 0.4 % in the third quarter .
dunkin ' donuts itself - about 70 % of overall sales - missed analysts ' estimates .
dunkin ' is fighting for turf with mcdonald 's and burger king , both of which have been expanding their ranges and offering cheaper items.net income slipped to $ 52.2m from $ 52.7m last time .

documents.title: us markets are go
text: wall street opens up - gaining 126 points to 23,455.79 , or 0.54 % .
there 's a flood of results for investors to ponder , including twitter , and later alphabet , amazon and microsoft .
there was a bit of a judder in pre-trading after a report that current fed chair janet yellen and former fed governor kevin warsh were out of the race for the central bank 's top job .
the white house said no final decision had been made .

documents.title: deutsche boerse boss to leave - more
text: carsten kengeter 's departure comes after a meeting of deutsche boerse 's supervisory board .
it all goes back to €4.5m shares bought by mr kengeter just before the merger between deutsche boerse and the london stock exchange in early 2016 .
deutsche and mr kengeter said the share purchase was allowed - but had agreed a deal that would see the company pay €10.5m and he pay €500,000 - it needed court approval and did n't get it .
deutsche boerse supervisory board chairman joachim faber had to cut short his visit to china and come back to frankfurt to take part in the meeting .
mr kengeter 's contract as chief executive expires at the end of march 2018 in any case .

documents.title: deutsche boerse chief to step down
text: deutsche boerse announces its chief executive will resign .
the move comes amid continuing allegations of insider trading .
carsten kengeter will not rush out the door though .
he will go at the end of the year .

documents.title: european inflation will be 'v-shaped '
text: mario draghi says that he expects that inflation will be 1.5 % this year , 1.2 % in 2018 and 1.5 % in the following 12 months .
he says that inflation recovery will be `` v-shaped '' .

documents.title: inflation will fall further by year end , says draghi
text: ecb president mario draghi is now speaking after announcing plans to taper its €60bn monthly asset-buying programme .
he says that inflation - which is currently 1.5 % and below the central bank 's target of 2 % - is expected to `` temporarily decline towards the end of the year '' because of energy prices .
he says that although there are signs of an uptick in the measures of underlying inflation , he says they are yet to show a convincing upward trend .
however , mr draghi says that inflation will rise in the medium-term .

documents.title: retailers 'feel the pinch '
text: retail sales fell at the fastest rate for more than eight years in the 12 months to october , the cbi says ( see previous post ) .
the organisation says this is a 'critical time ' .
for the retail sector .
it 's clear retailers are beginning to really feel the pinch from higher inflation .
while retail sales can be volatile from month to month , the steep drop in sales in october echoes other recent data pointing to a marked softening in consumer demand .
this is a critical time for a sector that employs three million people across britain .

the government can give retailers , especially those on the high street , some much needed relief in next month 's budget by bringing forward the planned switch of business rates indexation from rpi to cpi .

documents.title: analysis : barclays boss 'under pressure '
text: barclays shares are getting hammered on continuing concerns over the performance of its investment bank where revenues were down 18 % .
reviving this bit of the bank is the centrepiece of chief executive jes staley 's strategy and there is little evidence he 's delivering as barclays is underperforming its peers .

already under scrutiny by the regulator for his handling of a whistleblowing incident , he is now under pressure from shareholders growing impatient with the profitability of the uk 's only global investment bank .
barclays is also embroiled in a fight with the us government over how many billions it should pay in fines for its role in selling risky mortgages .
plus , it 's been charged with fraud over funds raised in qatar after the crisis .
staley asked shareholders to keep faith with him today - but with the bank currently valued at just over half what its worth on paper - for now he 's preaching to the unconverted .
author: Simon Jack
BBC Business Editor

documents.title: no 'taper tantrum ' from the ecb
text: neil wilson , senior market analyst at etx capital , says : `` it looks like the ecb is managing a taper without a tantrum .
`` for the first time in many meetings we got a truly different policy statement and one that seems to strike a pretty good balance between the hawks and the doves . ''
he says that the cut in quantitative easing to €30bn a month `` is pretty much slap bang in the mid-point of market expectations and should ruffle few feathers '' .
he adds : `` by and large this treads a fine line and one that [ ecb president mario ] draghi and co are getting pretty adept at following . ''

documents.title: ecb bond-buying could rise again if conditions worsen
text: here 's the key section of the ecb 's announcement that it is to begin reining in its economic stimulus from january .
it says it will continue its quantitative easing programme at €60bn until december .

`` from january 2018 the net asset purchases are intended to continue at a monthly pace of €30bn until the end of september 2018 , or beyond , if necessary , and in any case until the governing council sees a sustained adjustment in the path of inflation consistent with its inflation aim . ''

the central bank adds : `` if the outlook becomes less favourable , or if financial conditions become inconsistent with further progress towards a sustained adjustment in the path of inflation , the governing council stands ready to increase the asset purchase programme in terms of size and/or duration . ''

documents.title: breakingecb to halve bond-buying from january
text: the european central bank has announced that it will halve its monthly bond-buying programme to €30bn from january next year until september .

documents.title: twitter cuts losses but sales fall
text: twitter trimmed losses in the third quarter but reported a 4 % fall in revenue to $ 590m
the micro-blogging site reported a pre-tax loss of $ 17.5m for the three months to 30 september compared to $ 96.3m in the previous period .
on an adjusted earnings before interest , tax , depreciation and amortisation ( ebitda ) basis , twitter 's profit improved to $ 206m from $ 181.3m last year .
monthly active users ( mau ) rose by 4 % in the quarter to 330 million while its daily active users ( dau ) grew by 14 % compared to the same three months last year .
twitter 's chief executive jack dorsey , says : `` we 're proud that the improvements we 're making to the product continue to bring people back to twitter on a daily basis . ''
it forecasts that adjusted ebitda will reach between $ 220m and $ 240m in the fourth quarter , adding : `` we also expect that at the high end of our adjusted ebitda range '' .

documents.title: ford drives up profits
text: car giant ford has reported better-than-expected quarterly net profits .
the second-largest us car maker made a net profit of $ 1.56bn in the three months to the end of september up more then 60 % on the $ 960m it notched up a year earlier .
the performance was boosted by by sales of high-margin trucks and suvs in the us along with cost cutting .
third quarter sales for the group - including its credit business - rose to $ 36,451m - up from $ 35,943m for the same time last year .
this quarter demonstrates that our team 's focus on fitness is showing early promise .
but we also know that we must accelerate that progress in the near term , while taking the necessary steps to fundamentally redesign our business operations to be more fit for the long term .

documents.title: barclays shares extend losses
text: barclays is leading the ftse 100 fallers in midday trading , with its share price down 5.48 % at 186.20p after the bank 's third quarter profits missed analyst forecasts .
mining group rio tinto is the top blue chip riser , up 2.39 % at 186.20p .
overall , the ftse 100 is ahead 34.78 points at 7,481.99 .
the ftse 250 is up 47.15 points at 20,120.45 .
the pound is down 0.28 % on the euro at €1.11920 .
sterling is off 0.33 % on the dollar at $ 1.32180 .

documents.title: cbi survey : retail sales fall worst since financial crisis
text: retail sales fell at the quickest rate for more than eight years in the year to october , according to the latest monthly cbi survey .
the drop was the worst since the depths of the financial crisis .
looking ahead , retailers said they expect sales volumes to stabilise in the year to november .
online sales growth slowed in the year to october , to a pace just below the long-run average - but they 're also expected to up next month .
recreational goods and hardware & diy performed well , but department stores and specialist food & drink saw sales fall .

documents.title: bridge misses trickbbc personal finance correspondent tweets
text: the european union 's top court has ruled that the card game bridge is not a sport , dashing the hopes of english tournament organisers who were hoping for tax relief .
the judges in luxembourg decided that for tax purposes the concept of sport should involve what it called a `` not negligible physical element '' .
bridge is not a sport rules ecj because it does n't have a `` not negligible physical element '' .
so tournaments have to charge vat
what about chess ?

documents.title: fun with numbers
text: the office for national statistics has produced a natty interactive graphic to show how much less women are paid than men in different professions .
spoiler alert !
of the seven jobs featured , women fare better in only two .

documents.title: new us flight security measures take effect
text: new security measures affecting flights into the us are coming into effect , which us authorities say are aimed at reducing the threat of hidden explosives .
they include enhanced screening of passengers and electronic devices .
about 2,000 commercial flights a day from more than 100 countries will be affected .
read more here .

documents.title: sterling falls further against the euro
text: the pound is now trading down 0.29 % against the euro at €1.11900 , ahead of an announcement by the european central bank at 12.45pm which is expected to set out plans to begin winding down its €60bn a month bond-buying programme .
sterling is off 0.36 % on the dollar at $ 1.32130 .

documents.title: piccadilly circus lights back on
text: the billboard lights at piccadilly circus have been switched back on following major renovations .
the sign , which has displayed electrical advertisements for more than a century , was switched off in january and replaced with a temporary banner .
the new state-of-the-art screen is interactive and fully responsive allowing advertisers to include aspects such as live video streaming .
about 100 million people pass the central london site each year .
before january it was the first time since world war two the lights had been switched off , apart from during power cuts and special events .
read the full story here

documents.title: bombardier to axe 280 belfast jobs
text: aerospace firm bombardier is planning to cut another 280 jobs at its ni operations , the unite union has said .
it is the latest in a series of redundancies which form part of the company 's five-year plan to cut costs and increase profitability .
read more here

documents.title: monarch may face fight over landing slots
text: the financial times is reporting that the administrator of monarch airlines is seeking a judicial review if the carrier is stripped of its landing and take-off slots .
the assets are potentially worth millions of pounds .
the airport coordination limited is due to tell carriers what slots they will have access to for summer 2018 .

blair nimmo , partner at kmpg and a joint administrator of monarch , told the financial times : given the complexity of the slot exchange process , we are seeking a judicial review on this particular matter . ''

documents.title: retail jobs cut at record rate
text: british retailers cut jobs at a record rate over the past three months because of technology innovation and rising employment costs .
the british retail consortium ( brc ) says that the total number of employees fell by 3 % in the third quarter compared with the same period last year .
the number of hours worked also fell - it was down 4.2 % between july and september in comparison with 2016 .
brc chief executive helen dickinson , says : `` the pace of job reductions in the retail industry is gathering steam .
the three months to september saw the sharpest year-on-year drop in hours and employment since the monitor started in 2008 . ''

she adds : `` behind this shrinking of the workforce is both a technological revolution in retail , which is reducing demand for labour , and government policy , which is driving up the cost of employment . ''

documents.title: sophia the robot is granted citizenship
text: this is sophia .
she is a humanoid artificial intelligence robot and saudi arabia has just granted her citizenship - making sophia the first robot to enjoy such an honour .
sophia was delighted , saying : `` this is historical to be the first robot in the world to be recognized with a citizenship . ''
of course , this is entirely normal and not terrifying at all .

documents.title: there 's good news and there 's bad news
text: the office for national statistics ( ons ) has announced that in the year to april , full-time weekly wages rose by 2.2 % compared with the previous 12 months .
on the downside , when adjusted for inflation , pay fell by 0.4 % .
the ons announced that the gender pay gap for full-time workers narrowed to the lowest gap since 1997 .
however , woman are still paid 9.1 % less than men .

documents.title: barclays shares take a dive
text: shares in barclays fell by 5 % after its third-quarter profits figures came in below analysts ' expectations .
profits for the period were up by 31 % to £ 1.1bn , giving the bank a profit for the nine months so far of £ 3.4bn .
but its investment banking profits were down from £ 1bn to £ 652m , in what the bank said had been a difficult quarter for its markets business .
read the full story here

documents.title: legoland to open in new york
text: a legoland park is set to open in new york in 2020 - the third in the us .
owner merlin entertainments - which owns madame tussauds and alton towers in the uk - says the park , 60 miles north-west of new york city , will cost $ 350m ( £ 265m ) .
legoland new york will be the ninth park worldwide .
there are already legoland parks in california and florida in the us .
legoland dubai ( opened a year ago and in april of this year one opened in japan .
there are plans in the pipeline for a park in south korea and more in china .
the new development will employ 800 people to build it and 1,000 jobs on completion .

documents.title: ikea apologises for 'sexist ' china ad
text: ikea has apologised and pulled a controversial television advertisement in china which some said was sexist .
the commercial by the swedish furniture chain shows a mother scolding her daughter for not `` bringing home a boyfriend '' to meet her parents .
it attracted accusations of insensitivity towards single women .
unmarried females , colloquially known as `` leftover women '' in china , have long faced pressure to wed in a society that prioritises marriage .
read more here

documents.title: 'nature of work ' is a challenge in hospitality
text: pizza hut 's gareth hopley told wake up to money that the `` big challenge '' around mental heath in the restaurant or hospitality industry is the `` nature of the work '' .
staff are often aged between 16 and their early 20s and they 're on their feet all day , dealing with members of the public some of whom can be in `` very varying moods '' .
`` you can certainly see where workers are having a stressful day , no question about it , '' he said .

`` some of these people we 're asking to do this on a daily basis and to smile and put forward a level of service that the business they 're working for wants to see , there is pressure to do it , it is a difficult job .

`` it may not always be the cause of stress , but it certainly could contribute in some way , so [ you need to have ] have an environment in those businesses - which we 're trying to drive - which allows people to put their hand up , have a conversation .

`` but i think more importantly the key to this is not just saying it 's ok , it 's providing training so managers are able to have those conversations , can spot signs where workers need help and can have conversations away from standard performance-based conversations , just to make sure they 're ok . ''
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: hurricanes blow munich re 's profit hopes
text: reinsurance giant munich re has issued a profit warning after it said hurricanes harvey , irma and maria will cost the business at least €2.7bn ( £ 2.4bn ) .
the company now expects a third quarter loss of €1.4bn and a `` small profit '' for the full-year .

munich re says that the estimated costs from the hurricanes are `` still fraught with considerable uncertainty '' and it says that if you factor in other natural catastrophes - in particular the earthquakes in mexico - overall major-loss expenditure will amount to €3.2bn in the third quarter .
chief financial officer jörg schneider says : `` high losses from severe natural catastrophes are part and parcel of our business ; that is why we are here .
`` our capital base remains very strong .
we will continue to offer our clients full reinsurance capacity . ''

documents.title: will more telecoms firms cut bills ?
text: so far only bt has said it will cut bills for landline customers .
on today , ofcom 's director for competition jonathan oxley repeated the message that ofcom expected that to change ( see previous post ) .
`` we 've observed with the marketplace that the other providers have been following bt 's price changes .
in fact that 's why we 've stepped in and acted because the market has not functioned well in the last couple of years .
`` the differential between providers has now narrowed and historically providers have followed bt 's prices in lockstep so we expect other providers to follow suit . ''
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: pound dips on euro ahead of ecb decision
text: the pound is trading marginally lower against the euro on thursday morning ahead of an announcement by the european central bank on whether it will begin to taper its €60bn a month bond-buying programme .
sterling fell 0.18 % on the single currency to €1.12030 .
the pound was also off against the dollar , down 0.17 % at $ 1.32400 .

documents.title: why ca n't bt cut bills sooner ?
text: the cut in bt 's landline-only charges is not due to happen until april next year ( see earlier post )
on today , jonathan oxley , ofcom 's director for competition explained why it would n't take effect sooner .
`` in terms of the timing , the timing is the earliest that we can require bt to do it because of the systems that they 've got to change .
it 's it issues that need to be addressed to get the change done by april . ''
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: deutsche bank income jumps 51 %
text: deutsche bank says that pre-tax profit for the third quarter jumped by 51 % to €933m ( £ 833 ) but revenue fell by 10 % to €6.8bn between june and september .

turnover in its corporate and investment banking business fell by 23 % because of `` muted client activity '' as well as tough comparatives to last year when it saw `` high levels of client activity post-brexit '' .

deutsche bank 's chief executive john cryan , says : `` while the revenue environment remained challenging , we have made significant progress on our key initiatives such as the planned merger of deutsche bank and postbank in germany as well as the preparation for the ipo of our asset management business .
`` we are convinced that the benefits of our efforts will step by step become more apparent in the coming quarters and years . ''
overnight , it emerged that deutsche bank had agreed to pay $ 220m ( £ 150m ) to resolve a us investigation into its manipulation of interest rates .

documents.title: qantas shares hit turbulence in mixed asian session
text: it was a bumpy ride for qantas in sydney trading after the airline flagged slower growth ahead .
the carrier forecast a rise in first-half profit but expects domestic competition to weigh on earnings later in 2018 .
the stock crashed as much as 7.2 % during the session , before recovering to close down 1.4 % .
the broader s & p/asx 200 index added 0.2 % or 10.7 points , to end at 5916.30 .
elsewhere in asia , japan 's nikkei 225 gained 0.2 % , or 32.2 points , to close at 21,739.78 .
hong kong 's hang seng was 0.2 % lower in morning trading .

documents.title: heathrow sales and profits grow
text: pre-tax profit at heathrow rose by 13.4 % to £ 229m over the nine months to 30 september .
revenue increased by 3.2 % to £ 2.1bn .

chief executive john holland-kaye , said : `` a strong performance over the summer - record numbers of passengers visiting britain , double-digit growth in exports , strong global investor support and better service and value for passengers - shows what a critical national asset heathrow has become . ''
earlier this week , the department of transport re-opened a public consultation on a planned third runway at heathrow airport to include new evidence .

documents.title: kobe loses certificate for some products
text: japan 's scandal-hit kobe steel has been stripped of its industrial certificate for some products .
the company said its certificate was revoked due to `` improper quality management '' found at kobe 's hatano copper plant southwest of tokyo .
the decision could further hurt japan 's third largest steelmaker as its clients have already been switching to its competitors .
since kobe steel admitted faking data on some products earlier this month , the scandal has deepened after it emerged that more than 500 companies received products that could have been affected .

documents.title: ftse 100 flat but barclays shares lose ground
text: the ftse 100 is pretty flat at the start of trading on thursday at 7,448.10 , a rise of just les than one point or 0.01 % .
of the key stocks which have been in the news so far this morning , barclays shares are down by 3.6 % , bt 's are 0.64 % lower and debenhams have shed 2.72 % .

documents.title: ofcom wants more phone companies to cut bills
text: in addition to the 800,000 bt landline-only customers who will automatically see their bills going down from next april , a further 200,000 customers on bt 's 'home phone saver ' package `` may also be eligible '' , said ofcom .
`` this group of customers can choose to stay on their current package , or move to the standard product being cut , depending on which is the best deal for them . ''
of the uk 's 1.5 million landline-only customers 1 million are with bt .
`` this position has allowed bt to increase prices without much risk of losing customers , and other providers have followed bt 's pricing lead .
`` we expect bt 's £ 7 price cut to mean other providers can follow suit , '' said ofcom .

documents.title: debenhams cautious on christmas
text: debenhams gave a cautious outlook for christmas .
the department store chain 's chief executive sergio bucher , said : `` the environment remains uncertain and we face tough comparatives over the key christmas weeks .

`` however , we are well prepared for peak trading and the early signs from our activity to date confirm that we are moving in the right direction towards a successful and profitable future for debenhams . ''

documents.title: south korea chip maker posts record profit
text: sk hynix , the world 's second largest memory chip maker , has delivered a bumper profit thanks to surging demand for its products .
the sale of its chips , used in smartphones and servers , pushed third-quarter operating profit up more than five-fold to a record .
earlier this month the firm 's bigger rival samsung said it was on track for another record profit due to higher memory chip prices .
sk hynix is also part of a consortium led by bain capital buying embattled toshiba 's memory chip unit .

documents.title: beauty proves a bright spot for debenhams
text: debenhams announced a fall in annual pre-tax profits to £ 59m compared with £ 105.8m in the previous 12 months .
group sales were marginally lower at £ 2.3bn .
however , like-for-like sales rose by 2.1 % on strong demand in its beauty division , where it sells brands such as kat von d and too faced , as well as in food .
debenhams said its digital sales grew 12.7 % over the year , driven by mobile orders which rose by 57 % in the uk .

documents.title: bt reacts
text: we welcome a balanced voluntary agreement with ofcom which means that up to 1 million of our customers who do n't have broadband will receive a substantial cut in the price of their line rental from april 2018 .

we already offer low income customers on certain benefits a special tariff called 'bt basic ' and also offer home phone saver that provides a great value bundle for customers who want a traditional phone service , with anytime calls and other benefits

documents.title: barclays boss hawkish on rate rise
text: barclays 's boss jes staley is taking a hawkish stance on interest rates after of the bank of england 's meeting next week .

the chief executive tells bloomberg : `` at the imf meeting in washington , the general consensus among central bankers is that economuc growth has got to the point where central banks are returning to a more normalised monetary policy . ''
he says : `` it is time i think to begin to normalise monetary policy . ''
but mr staley expects any interest rate rises will be done in a way that will help economic growth .

documents.title: how will bt landline only cuts work ?
text: the cut in bt 's landline-only bills will take effect from april 2018
these landline-only customers - who currently pay £ 18.99 per month for line rental - will pay £ 11.99 , reducing their phone bill by £ 84 a year .
ofcom said this 37 % reduction would return bt 's line rental for these households `` to a similar level to 2009 '' .
`` at least 800,000 of these landline-only customers do n't have to do anything to claim this price cut - it will appear on their bills automatically .
they will then be protected from real-term price increases , with line rental and call costs capped at the rate of inflation .

documents.title: a tale of two divisions
text: barclays ' international business reported a 15 % slump in pre-tax profits to to £ 3.2bn following a 14 % fall in income from its investment banking business during the third quarter .
conversely , in the uk pre-tax profits rose 12 % to £ 1.2bn .
barclays said that its plan to ring-fence its retail bank `` remain in track '' .
it said : `` we intend to complete the restructure and fully establish the uk ring-fenced bank in april 2018 , ahead of the 1 january 2019 legislative deadline for implementation . ''

commenting on the results , barclays ' chief executive jes staley says that the third quarter `` was particularly significant for barclays as it was the first for many years in which we have not been in some state of restructuring '' .

documents.title: landlines can be 'lifeline '
text: more on the news that bt is to cut the cost of landline only bills by about £ 84 a year , following a review by regulator ofcom .
for many people , their landline is their lifeline .
but households who only have a landline - and no broadband - have seen their phone bills soar .
many are elderly , and have been with bt for decades .

documents.title: breakingbt 's landline only customers see bills slashed
text: bt customers who buy only a landline telephone service will see their monthly bills slashed by £ 7 per month , following an ofcom review .
this represents a saving of £ 84 a year , or 37 % , for up to one million of bt 's landline-only
ofcom said they had been getting poor value for money in recent years , compared to those who buy bundles of landline , broadband and/or pay-tv services .
nearly two thirds ( 66 % ) of customers with only a landline are over 65 , and more than three quarters ( 77 % ) have never switched provider , the regulator added .

documents.title: brexit and diesel weigh on car output
text: doubt over the future of diesel cars and uncertainty surrounding brexit have contributed to a sharp fall in uk car production .

documents.title: ecb bond-buying to 'ease in january '
text: standard chartered bank 's saran hewin says the ecb 's quantitative easing ( qe ) programme has helped the european economy in terms of easier credit conditions , stronger lending and a recovery in investing .
she says that some policymakers would like the central bank 's qe programme to continue because of concerns about low inflation .

but ms hewin says : `` the majority believe that the economy has reached a position where it is in self-sustaining growth and therefore they can afford to reduce some of the bond purchases they 're making over the coming months . ''

we expect that [ the ecb ] will begin to reduce their monthly bond purchases from january next year and potentially by september or at the very latest by the end of next year the ecb will no longer be buying bonds . ''

documents.title: low inflation dogs europe
text: will the european central bank finally begin to taper off its massive €60bn a month quantitative easing programme later on thursday ?
sarah hewin , chief economist for europe at standard chartered bank says that the european economy is in `` pretty good '' shape with annualised gdp growth of around 2 % and unemployment is falling .
`` the problem is inflation is still too low , '' she tells the bbc 's today programme .
`` it is below the european central bank 's target [ of 2 % ] and is likely to stay below target for the next couple of years . ''

text: the latest uk car production figures for september are out this morning - and output has fallen for the fifth month this year .
